MSqb2 0.2.1

Export Differential Expression Results to Excel

export_DE_result.Rd

This function exports the results of a differential expression analysis to an Excel file. The results are organized into sheets by comparison, with significant results highlighted for easy identification.

Usage

export_DE_result(
  dat,
  lfc.col = "logFC",
  apv.col = "adj.P.Val",
  gene.col = "Gene",
  prot.col = "Protein",
  negFill = "skyblue1",
  posFill = "pink",
  noSigFill = "grey90",
  sigFill = "red",
  sigFont = "darkred",
  tableStyle = "TableStyleLight8",
  file.name = "limma.stat_output",
  path = Tables.path,
  sig.level = 0.05,
  silent = FALSE
)

Arguments

dat

A data.table containing the differential expression results. It should include columns for log-fold change, adjusted p-values, and identifiers for genes or proteins.

lfc.col

A character string specifying the column name for the log-fold change values. Default is "logFC".

apv.col

A character string specifying the column name for the adjusted p-values. Default is "adj.P.Val".

gene.col

A character string specifying the column name for gene identifiers. Default is "Gene".

prot.col

A character string specifying the column name for protein identifiers. Default is "Protein".

negFill

A character string specifying the fill color for negative log-fold changes. Default is "skyblue1".

posFill

A character string specifying the fill color for positive log-fold changes. Default is "pink".

noSigFill

A character string specifying the fill color for non-significant results. Default is "grey90".

sigFill

A character string specifying the fill color for significant results. Default is "red".

sigFont

A character string specifying the font color for significant results. Default is "darkred".

tableStyle

A character string specifying the table style for the Excel sheets. Default is "TableStyleLight8".

file.name

A character string specifying the base name for the output Excel file. Default is "limma.stat_output".

path

A character string specifying the directory path where the Excel file will be saved. Default is Tables.path.

sig.level

A numeric value specifying the significance level threshold for adjusted p-values. Default is 0.05.

silent

A logical value. If TRUE, suppresses messages during the function's execution. Default is FALSE.

Value

A Workbook object from the openxlsx package representing the Excel file that was created.

Details

The export_DE_result function processes the differential expression results, organizes them by comparison, and saves them into an Excel workbook. Each comparison is placed into a separate sheet. Significant results are highlighted with configurable colors and styles.

If comparison names exceed 30 characters, they are shortened, and a mapping file (longCompNames.txt) is generated to track the original and shortened names. This ensures compatibility with Excel's sheet name length limits.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  # Assuming `de_results` is a data.table with differential expression results
  export_DE_result(de_results, file.name = "DE_analysis_results")
} # }
